rules.natural: If the winery uses oak barrels, then it operates a premium vineyard.
Under the condition that the winery uses stainless steel tanks, if the winery has skilled winemakers, then it produces high-quality wine.
Whenever the winery possesses French oak, it uses oak barrels.
Either the winery has French oak or it has American oak.
Provided that the winery possesses American oak, it uses stainless steel tanks.
The winery has modern equipment or it employs traditional methods.
Under the condition that the winery employs traditional methods, if the winery does not have funding, then it has an ideal climate.
The winery has skilled winemakers or it has inexperienced staff.
If the winery has inexperienced staff, then, under the condition that it has modern equipment, it uses advanced fermentation techniques.
If it is not the case that the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation, then the winery's production does not fail.

If it is not the case that the negation of 'the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation' leads to production failure, then the winery's production succeeds.

facts.natural: It is not the case that the winery has an ideal climate.
The winery does not operate a premium vineyard.
The winery does not use advanced fermentation techniques.
The winery does not produce high-quality wine.
The winery's production does not succeed.

Provided that the winery does not have funding, it has an ideal climate.

natural_facts.A2: The winery uses advanced fermentation techniques.
natural_facts.A10: The winery operates a premium vineyard.
natural_facts.A12: The winery uses stainless steel tanks.

(A10 ∨ (A8 → A5)).natural: Either the winery operates a premium vineyard or, provided that the winery has skilled winemakers, it produces high-quality wine.

(A11 → A10).natural: If the winery uses oak barrels, then it operates a premium vineyard.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: The winery uses oak barrels or it uses stainless steel tanks.

(A12 → (A8 → A5)).natural: Under the condition that the winery uses stainless steel tanks, if the winery has skilled winemakers, then it produces high-quality wine.

(A13 → A11).natural: Whenever the winery possesses French oak, it uses oak barrels.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the winery has French oak or it has American oak.

(A14 → A12).natural: Provided that the winery possesses American oak, it uses stainless steel tanks.

(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)).natural: The winery uses advanced fermentation techniques or, if the winery lacks funding, then it has an ideal climate.

(A3 → A2).natural: If the winery has modern equipment, then it uses advanced fermentation techniques.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: The winery has modern equipment or it employs traditional methods.

(A4 → (¬G → A1)).natural: Under the condition that the winery employs traditional methods, if the winery does not have funding, then it has an ideal climate.

(A5 ∨ (A3 → A2)).natural: The winery produces high-quality wine or, if the winery has modern equipment, then it uses advanced fermentation techniques.

(A8 → A5).natural: Whenever the winery has skilled winemakers, it produces high-quality wine.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: The winery has skilled winemakers or it has inexperienced staff.

(A9 → (A3 → A2)).natural: If the winery has inexperienced staff, then, under the condition that it has modern equipment, it uses advanced fermentation techniques.

(¬(A5 ∨ (A3 → A2)) → A6).natural: If it is not the case that the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation, then the winery's production fails.

(¬(A5 ∨ (A3 → A2)) → ¬A6).natural: If it is not the case that the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation, then the winery's production does not fail.

(¬(¬(A5 ∨ (A3 → A2)) → A6) → A7).natural: If it is not the case that the negation of 'the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation' leads to production failure, then the winery's production succeeds.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that the winery does not have funding, it has an ideal climate.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the winery has an ideal climate.

¬A10.natural: The winery does not operate a premium vineyard.

¬A2.natural: The winery does not use advanced fermentation techniques.

¬A5.natural: The winery does not produce high-quality wine.

¬A7.natural: The winery's production does not succeed.
